New Records: The Dodgers hit their second-most home runs (24) in a single postseason in franchise history.
Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani exited the game in the seventh inning due to a shoulder injury.
Yoshinobu Yamamoto pitched 6⅓ innings, giving up only one hit, two walks, and striking out four.
Freddie Freeman hit a home run in the third inning.
Teoscar Hernandez hit a two-run home run.
Tommy Edman hit a home run in the second inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Dave Roberts commented on Ohtani's shoulder subluxation and mentioned that further testing would be done.
Roberts expressed optimism about Ohtani's condition, stating that his strength and range of motion were good.
The Dodgers' excitement over their 2-0 series lead was tempered by concerns about Ohtani's injury.
